page.title: 03Downsview Primary School
page.content: Downsview Junior School is 18 years old.A day school which 184 pupils attend-98 boys and 86 girls aged 7-11 - housed in 6 classes each with its own teacher.The school also has a secretary ,caretaker,3 kitchen staff and 3 dinner supervisors. Downsview Infants,built in 1965 has 61 boys and 59 girls aged 5-7.There are 4.5 teachers for 4 classes,a caretaker, secretary,welfare assistant,2 kitchen staff and 4 dinner supervisors.At both schools,the hall doubles as a dining room. Facilities in each school include a library,staffroom,office and Head's room.They each own radios,a video , computer,colour TV and tape recorders. Lessons include reading,maths,english, science,art,PE and RE.There are assemblies each day.Outside are 3 playgrounds and a large field.
